com.wingfoot.wsdl
Class Binding

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.wingfoot.wsdl.Binding
public class Binding
extends java.lang.Object

Binding is the necessary step of associating a transport protocol and a data format with a bunch of messages, operations and port types. In other words, binding nails down the abstract onto something concrete.

Constructor Summary

          Creates a Binding with the given name for a previously defined portType.

Binding

public Binding(QName bindingName,
               PortType portType)
Creates a Binding with the given name for a previously defined portType.
Parameters:
bindingName - QName for the binding.
portType - the PortType to associate the Binding with.

isOperationRPC

public boolean isOperationRPC(Operation operation)
                       throws WSDLException
Given an operation, determines if the Operation style is RPC or Document.
Returns:
boolean true if the operation style is RPC; false if document.
Throws:
WSDLException - if the Operation cannot be found in the Binding.

Converts an instance of this Binding to WSDL

writer - the XMLWriter to write the WSDL to.
